meanings.definition: Soil or other material used to fill in an excavated area.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers brought in backfill to fill the hole.
meanings.sent2: The backfill was necessary to level the ground after digging.
meanings.sent3: The backfill looked like a giant puzzle piece fitting perfectly into the gap.
meanings.sent4: The backfill acted as a blanket, covering the exposed earth.
meanings.sent5: The backfill consisted of rocks, sand, and dirt mixed together.

meanings.definition: To fill in an excavated area with soil or other material.
meanings.sent1: They had to backfill the trench to prevent it from collapsing.
meanings.sent2: The workers will backfill the pit once the foundation is set.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to backfill the hole with colorful sand for fun.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to backfill the emptiness in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped to naturally backfill the hole with mud.
